Paper.Title: Looking for the presence of linguistic concepts in the prosody of spoken utterances

Section.Paragraph: This paper describes an experimental method for detecting prosodic functions.

We assume that the first step towards content driven synthetic prosody generation (Concept-to-speech) is invariably to determine the perceptually relevant prosodic features. The proposed method has been applied to the detection of syntactic structure: dialogue acts and given/new distinction. First results are being discussed.
